thread.title: Business Breakfast LIVE: easyJet profit loss blamed on Brexit and terror attacks, plus latest news
thread.title_full: Business Breakfast LIVE: easyJet profit loss blamed on Brexit and terror attacks, plus latest news

author: Kathryn Riddell
title: Business Breakfast LIVE: easyJet profit loss blamed on Brexit and terror attacks, plus latest news
text:
Kathryn Riddell Heathrow runway won't break pollution laws, research suggests 
Research has suggested a new runway could be built at Heathrow without breaking pollution laws, it has been reported. 
The BBC said the independent study, led by the University of Cambridge, measured poisonous nitrogen dioxide (NO2) levels using 40 sensors in and around the London airport. 
London mayor Sadiq Khan made a last-ditch plea to Theresa May this week, calling for an extra runway to be built at Gatwick rather than Heathrow. 
The shortlisted options being considered are a third runway at Heathrow, extending its existing northern runway, and a second runway at Gatwick. A British Airways plane taking off from Heathrow Airport 
Speaking about the Heathrow study, Professor Rod Jones from the University of Cambridge told the BBC: “If there is the development of a third runway, we expect there to be a marginal increase in NO2 coming from the airport itself, but that would be against the background of reduced NO2 from other traffic, because of Euro 6 engines and electrification of the traffic fleet.” 
He added: “By deploying a network of sensors we can tell directly from the measurements, what’s been emitted locally from Heathrow airport and what’s been blown in, mostly from central London. That’s the real strength of the sensor network. 
“The major result from this study is that we have tested the models far more critically than you can from a single measurement site.” 08:15 Kathryn Riddell Construction starts on £18m Beacon of Light sports and education centre 
Construction company Tolent has started work on the creation of the £18m Beacon of Light centre in Sunderland . The Beacon of Light 
The Beacon of Light promises to be a unique education and sports facility, providing a permanent base for the Sunderland AFC-backed Foundation of Light, which now has school status. 
Tyneside-based FaulknerBrowns drew up plans for the building, which aims to inspire and motivate, and trustees of the charity have now approved the start of construction at a meeting at the Stadium of Light, triggering the arrival of construction teams. 08:08 Kathryn Riddell Brexit, terror attacks and strikes blames for easyJet profit fall 
Low-cost airline easyJet has revealed it will take a hit of more than £200 million from the plunging pound and a series of “extraordinary events” after terrorist attacks and air traffic control strikes have taken their toll. Mark Mowbray An easyJet plane landing at Newcastle Airport 08:00 Kathryn Riddell Thursday's breakfast blog 
Hello and welcome to the Journal Business team’s morning live blog for Thursday, October 6. 
I’m Kathryn Riddell and I’m running the live blog to bring you regular updates on all the breaking business news from across the North East and beyond. 
Here’s the latest business news and some of the highlights from yesterday.
